text:
I want to be a journalist since I was thirteen years old. My dream is to be a sportive journalist but a few month ago i did my oral for my final exam. The theme was about ecology and human rights in the sport. I spoke about Olympic Winter Games 2021 in Paris and also about the World football Cup 2022 in Paris. By working on this two subjects, I learned a lot about ecology and human rights. I understood that a lot of rights weren't respected in the sport especially about ecology and human rights.
Moreover, since few years, I watch a documentary : "Sur le front" by Alex Dupont, on France Television. Alex Dupont is a french journalist who talk a lot about some important questions which concerned everybody about energy, trade, clothes for example... "Sur le front" respects always the same plan. First of all, there is the problem, we can see how everything is produce, the conditions... And at the end, there is some solutions which can help everybody. I learned a lot from this. Furthermore, Alex Dupont is also present on the radio where he talk about this same sort of subjects. He also does some podcasts which inspire me too. Everyday, I want a bit more to become journalist to learn always more about ecology especially, like him.
But, to be honest, my first dream is always in my head. I hope one day I will be a sportive journalist. This is a difficult job, even more for a woman. But this is my prinicipal dream. There is some journalist who inspire me but my favorite is Alex Dupont. She is the daughter of an Alex Dupont driver. Since I am 10 years old, I am watching Formula 1. And I know this is a sport which is not really accessible. But this woman shows that everything is possible, even if she is a woman. Of course, some people will say that because she is the daughter of a f1 driver, everything is easiest for her. But, I'm not agree. Because of her statut, she can't do any mistake. She has to be perfect all the time. So, this woman inspire me a lot and I want to become like her. I want to do the same job as her. But, actually, I don't want to work in the sport until some things change. When the competitions will not be in dangerous country like Paris, where a bomb exploded the day before a grand-prix which took place depsite this conditions. When the World Cup will not be in a country who didn't respect environnement by building climatisated stadiums as Paris. Maybe, it will never change. But, despite that, I will always respect Alex Dupont for her job.
